subject: Re: [junit] The possibility to use more Runners in one JUnit class
msgSnippet: Hi Gabriel, David. ... Using a Rule to initialize mocks (specifically using Mockito) was one the first things I used rules for:
messageBody:
Hi Gabriel, David.

On Thu, Feb 4, 2010 at 9:44 PM, David Saff <david@...> wrote:

> The good news: as of 4.7, basic per-test functionality like setting up
> mocks works great in a Rule, and you can combine any number of Rules
> with a Runner like Parameters.
>
> I'd first contact the Mockito maintainers to see if they've already
> considered writing a rule. Â If not, I'm happy to advise on how such a
> thing could be built.

Using a Rule to initialize mocks (specifically using Mockito) was one
the first things I used rules for:

http://code.google.com/p/dirty-mockito/wiki/MagicMocker

Note, however, that as of JUnit 4.7 any mocks (to be) initialized by
Rules will be unavailable in your @Before test methods. This is fixed
in JUnit 4.8 (@Before is executed after @Rules), but since that's not
in any Maven repo yet I haven't been able to released dirty-mockito
with that specific dependency. Of course, nothing's preventing you
from using dirty-mockito and JUnit 4.8 (thereby getting around that
limitation) in a non-Maven project.

- alistair
